intro: Leucas trachyphylla, commonly known as the rough-leaved leucas, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. The plant's botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and herbal research.
